Title:
Cadophora species from marine glaciers on the Qinghai-Tibet
Plateau
Keywords:
Cadophora, cold-adapted fungi, novel species, phylogeny,
Qinghai-Tibeat Plateau
Abstract:
Based on preliminary analyses of ITS sequences, 28 fungal
strains belonging to the genus Cadophora were detected from 1208
cold-adapted fungi isolated from marine glaciers on the Qinghai-Tibet
Plateau. As one of the most encountered genera, 17 representative
isolates of the Cadophora strains were studied in detail with
Morphological and multi-locus phylogenetic analyses. Two phylogenetic
trees were constructed: one was based on the partial large subunit nrDNA
(LSU) to infer the taxonomic placements of our isolates and the other
was based on the combined genes of ITS, TUB and EF-1α to investigate
more exact phylogenetic relationships of them. Two known species and
eight new taxa were determined, including C. malorum, C. novi-eboraci,
C. mingyongensis sp. nov, C. frigid sp. nov, C. yunnanensis sp. nov,
C.daguensis sp. nov, C.indistincta sp. nov, C. magna sp. nov, C. inflata
sp. nov, C. yulongensis sp. nov, C. glacialis sp. nov. Temperature
selective test showing that most of the Cadophora isolates are
psychrotolerants that have optimum growth temperatures above
20℃，strains belonging to C. frigid sp. nov are psychrophilies and have
optimum growth temperatures near 15℃.Our results show that the diversity
of the Cadophora species in the marine glaciers on the Qinghai-Tibet
Plateau is very high and most of them represent novel species.
